author: deweese
msg: 1) Fixed AffineRed so it requests enough source to avoid artifacts
2) Fixed Composite Bridge so it adds the sources in the proper order
(although why "in" is drawn 'on top' of "in2" is beyond me...).
3) Added an enhancement to ConcreteGaussianBlurRable, it now
avoids using a residual affine if the Gaussian kernel is square
(meaning it's circularly symmetric) and the residual matrix would
be a simple rotation (perhaps with mirroring).
This is a very common case and it avoids performing an extra affine
operation so to savings may be significant.
